text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with potato chorizo mini-quiche
that's right we're doing a little

around stuff this is basically a little
big Dom let a little frittata and its

all right we're going to start by dicing
some chorizo it's a cured Spanish

it in half lengthwise turn it on the
flat side cut it into a couple strips
and then cut it across into a beautiful
small dice and we want to keep these
pieces kind of small because these are
of course mini quiche so you don't want
to much bigger than that
and by the way if you merkins can't find
chorizo you could just use pepperoni
pretty much any spicy cured dry sausage
would work here what about slim jims
what are you high oh you are okay then
that would work when your sausage is
dice go ahead and throw that in a

we're going to put the heat on
medium-low and we're just going to saute
that for a few minutes to infuse that
olive oil with that amazing chorizo
flavor and also even more importantly
that gorgeous orange paprika color all
right so just give it a stir once in a
while we're going to cook that for maybe
three or four minutes and that should be
just about enough time to dice one
potato and if you can't find potato
we're going to use potato so I have one
peeled medium size russet I'm going to
cut it in like quarter-inch thick slices
and then each of those into like
quarter-inch thick strips and just like
the sausage you're going to turn at 90
degrees and give it a nice small dice
and you can do one at a time if you want
or you could double it up and do two

pretty sure math invented the universe

with a little bit of garlic aioli
and yes that is redundant all right once
our potato is diced we're going to go
ahead and dump it into the pan and I'm
using a nice nonstick pan here I don't
want any issues with sticky and potatoes
turn the heat up to medium we'll give it
a big pitcher
salts and we're just going to simply
cook those potatoes until tender and how
long is that going to take I don't know
maybe about 10 minutes it depends on the
exact size of the dice but you'll know
because it will be smashable and or for
Keable and of course never use metal

on my resume
so once the potatoes are deemed tender
we're going to go ahead and transfer
those onto a paper towel-lined plate and

flavored we do not need any of the

let's go ahead and grate a little bit of

there are made by the woven mold this

I'm gonna grate some of that up and then
we're going to take our mini muffin tins

there you go frame of reference those

course you might have a little extra
that's not the worst thing that could

we're going to go ahead and do our egg

of cayenne an even bigger pinch of salt
and then I want you to beat those eggs
thoroughly I want them completely
liquefied I don't want any separation
between white and yolk so give it a
thorough beating and then I like to take
a little measuring cup and just fill
those up right to the top all right
maybe like a millionth of an inch from
the top but almost to the top
and then very important we have to give
it the old tap etapa
and the old shake of sheikha if you have
advanced skills you could do the
combination old shake a tappa but you
want to settle those down in case
there's any air pockets I'm going to
carefully transfer those onto a baking

with another pinch of our cheese and
those little beauties are ready for the
oven
so we're going to put those in a
preheated 350 degree oven for about 17
minutes and what will happen those will
just barely be firm to the touch
if the center's seem a little liquidy
let them go another minute or two but
after about 17 minutes they should be
just about set all right don't be scared
to touch him you won't break them you
might burn your finger but you won't
hurt the quiche and of course you're
